sense.gloss: to cool (e.g. from a high temperature to room temperature), to let cool
to dampen, to throw a damper on, to spoil

sdata.j: ↑作↑↓つく↓り↑方↑↓かた↓は↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓！↑鍋↑↓なべ↓に↑材料↑↓ざいりょう↓を↑入↑↓い↓れ↑火↑↓ひ↓にかけ、ひと↑煮立↑↓にた↓ちしたら↑火↑↓ひ↓を↑止↑↓と↓め、あとは|↑冷↑↓ひえ↓ます|だけです。
sdata.e: It's easy to make! All you have to do is put the ingredients in a pot, heat it up, turn off the heat once it boils, and let it cool.

sdata.j: ↑水分↑↓すいぶん↓が↑多↑↓おお↓く↑含↑↓ふく↓まれる↑夏↑↓なつ↓↑野菜↑↓やさい↓は、↑体内↑↓たいない↓の↑熱↑↓ねつ↓を|↑冷↑↓さ↓ます|↑作用↑↓さよう↓があります。
sdata.e: Summer vegetables that contain a lot of water have the effect of cooling down the body.

sdata.j: ↑煮物↑↓にもの↓は↑一↑↓いち↓↑度|↑↓ど↓↑冷↑↓さ↓ます|と、↑味↑↓あじ↓が↑染↑↓し↓みこみ↑美味↑↓おい↓しくなります。
sdata.e: If you give simmered food a moment to cool, the flavors will spread throughout the dish, and it'll taste really good.
